intro: Seddera namibica, commonly known as the Namibian seddera, is a flowering plant native to the Namib Desert. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which includes many succulent species adapted to arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange, attracting pollinators like bees and flies. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, helping it store water in its harsh habitat. Seddera namibica is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in sandy soils, showcasing its resilience to extreme conditions.
